Package myGame

Class Direction

java.lang.Object
myGame.Direction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Give a level of abstraction when speaking about direction. Allows to use functions such as isNorth() instead on relying on arbitrary values.
Since:
2019-12-23
Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Barillot and MaÃ«l Bouquinet

  • Constructor Details

    • Direction

      public Direction()
      By default, the direction in north.

    • Direction

      public Direction​(Point p)
      Generate a direction from a point.

      For example, Point(0, 1) will create a south direction. It might be a better idea to create a direction and then set the direction with a function such as setSouth().

      Parameters:
      p - the point that will be used to generate the direction.

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public Direction copy()
      Returns:
      a copy of the original direction.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Direction d)
      Parameters:
      d - another direction
      Returns:
      true if the direction are the same, otherwise false.

    • turnClockwise

      public void turnClockwise()
      Turns the direction clockwise.

    • turnCounterClockwise

      public void turnCounterClockwise()
      Turns the direction counter-clockwise.

    • toPoint

      public Point toPoint()
      Returns:
      a normalized point (distance 1 from the origin) and with the appropriate direction.

    • randomize

      public void randomize()
      Randomize the direction.

      public boolean isNorth()
